title: Design Thinking-Based Flipped Learning for Medical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and anatomical concepts
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning in limited-technology environments, targeting intermediate learners with prior medical education experience.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five-stage design thinking process (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to design clinical problem-solving workflows
Learners enhance their ability to develop collaborative diagnostic scenarios through peer feedback in flipped learning environments
Learners can analyze clinically collected mobile data to create personalized treatment plans

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
